main_text:
Small Set Theories
9. Small Set Theories

It is commonly noted that set theory produces far more superstructure
than is needed to support classical mathematics. In this section, we
describe two miniature theories which purport to provide enough
foundations without nearly as much superstructure. Our “pocket
set theory” (motivated by a suggestion of Rudy Rucker) is just
small; Vopenka’s alternative set theory is also
“nonstandard” in its approach.
hierarchy_title: Alternative Axiomatic Set Theories || Small Set Theories
